greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of deficiencies of divisors of n.
comment: a(n)=0 for n in A066218.  Are 1 and 12 the only solutions to a(n)=1? - _Robert Israel_, Dec 04 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
formula: If m and n are coprime, a(m*n) = 2*a(m)*A000203(n)+2*a(n)*A000203(m)-a(m)*a(n)-2*A000203(m)*A000203(n). - _Robert Israel_, Dec 04 2017
example: For n = 6, whose divisors are 1, 2, 3, 6, their deficiencies are 1, 1, 2, 0, thus a(6) = 1 + 1 + 2 + 0 = 4.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 04 2017
